results.title: Curriculum Victoria: growing and learning
results.creator_credit: Warren Thomas and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: A talk by Michael Norman, which highlights the changing expectations our society has for adolescents. With reference to students of 1912, 1948 and 1979, who appear in the program, mention is made of the narrowing academic learning that occurred rather than a broadening of the curriculum.

results.title: Currajong: a different way (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Steve Thomas and Steve Thomas Video Productions
results.brief_description: A look at Currajong Primary School, an establishment catering for “intelligent underachievers”. Describes its unique approach to working with kids who have failed in all kinds of schools.

results.title: Curious George rides a bike
results.brief_description: Based on the story by H.A. Rey with his illustrations, this animated film tells of the droll adventures, pranks and triumphs of a monkey called George when he is given a push bike for a present.

results.title: Curious George
results.brief_description: The mischievous exploits of Curious George the monkey in a delightful puppet animation adapted from the book of the same title by H.A. Rey. George is brought from the wilds of the jungle to the sophistication of the city and experiences a few mishaps along the way.

results.title: Cup final [1961]
results.brief_description: Sporting documentary on the 1961 FA Cup final of Tottenham Hotspurs versus Leicester City at Wembley Stadium. Historical in the sense that Spurs won 2-0 and became the first team in the history of English football to win both the League and Cup double.
results.description: Sporting documentary on the 1961 FA Cup final of Tottenham Hotspurs versus Leicester City at Wembley Stadium. Historical in the sense that Spurs won 2-0 and became the first team in the history of English football to win both the League and Cup double.

results.title: Cumberland story
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Jennings, Alexander Shaw and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: A dramatised documentary, made for the Ministry of Fuel and Power, aiming to reassure miners about the proposed nationalisation of the coal fields. Revolves around the dramatic tale of a disaster which involved the loss of many lives almost 100 years earlier. The seam located under the sea floor is opened up again for working, and with modern equipment and safety devices, there is little likelihood of a repetition of the old tragedy. Many of the roles are performed by the actual workers, Nimmo is played by a mining engineer and Stephenson is one of the mine leaders. Cinematography, Chick Fowle. Music, Arthur Benjamin performed by the Philharmonic Orchestra. Made in collaboration with the United Steel Companies and the National Union of Mine-Workers.
